channel.title: Docker.com on .NET Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Docker.com on .NET Ramblings

item.title: How to Build, Run, and Package AI Models Locally with Docker Model Runner
item.description: Introduction As a Senior DevOps Engineer and Docker Captain, I’ve helped build AI systems for everything from retail personalization to medical imaging. One truth stands out: AI capabilities are core to modern infrastructure. This guide will show you how to run and package local AI models with Docker Model Runner — a lightweight, developer-friendly tool... Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/how-to-build-run-and-package-ai-models-locally-with-docker-model-runner/

item.title: Publishing AI models to Docker Hub
item.description: When we first released Docker Model Runner, it came with built-in support for running AI models published and maintained by Docker on Docker Hub. This made it simple to pull a model like llama3.2 or gemma3 and start using it locally with familiar Docker-style commands. Model Runner now supports three new commands: tag, push, and... Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/publish-ai-models-on-docker-hub/
